title.native: 逃走中 グレートミッション

description:
The time is a future where humans have moved their residence to the moon.... In the lunar colony, a game has become very popular. The name of the game is "Run for the Money." It is an entertainment survival game in which fugitives are released into a limited area, and if they can escape from the pursuing android "hunters" until the time limit counts down to zero, they can win a large prize. Some dream of getting rich, while others challenge themselves to test their strength in "Run for the Money."

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Run for Money: The Great Mission

name.native: モーリス・シューメーカー

node.description: Animator and character designer affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/studio_pablo)

Founder and representative director of Studio Pablo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

A four-member Japanese pop band that formed in 2012 as an indie band. After releasing one album independently, they were signed in 2013 to Lantis. They released their debut single "Que Sera Sera" in August 2013. 

Fhána originally formed with [Junichi Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/127344), Yuxuki Waga and Kevin Mitsunaga, and all three had previously been involved in separate indie bands. Fhána did not have a fixed vocalist at first, instead employing guest vocalists to sing the band's songs. Fhána released their independent album New World Line on May 18, 2012 featuring four guest vocalists: Makiko Naka, Towana, IA, and Aoi Tada. In late 2012, Towana joined Fhána as the official vocalist. Fhána was signed to Lantis in 2013 and released their major debut single "Que Sera Sera" on August 21, 2013; the song is used as the ending theme to the 2013 anime series The Eccentric Family (Uchouten Kazoku).

A South Korean boy band that debuted in May 22, 2019.

The current members are: Jeon Woong, Kim Dong-hyun, Park Woo-jin, and Lee Dae-hwi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/548921222)

A freelance animator most known for his work on the various Toei Animation series. His animation cuts tend to include amazing visual effects with a very high frame rate, and can be recognized from various signatures. From hand-drawn smoke effects, to debris & background animation, Shida specializes in very dynamic action sequences, flying sequences, and various cuts on multiple anime openings.

__[Website](https://wienners.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wienners_wns) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/wienners_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/Wienners_ch)__

__Formed:__ 2008

__Biography:__
Wienners is a Japanese Galaxy Punk Band formed in Kichijoji, Tokyo in 2008 by a guitarist/vocalist TAMAYA2060%.
The band consists of TAMAYA2060%, ASAMISAE(Vo/Key/Sampler), ∴560∵(Ba/Cho) and KOZO(Dr), and they have been developing their extremely unique electric punk rock for years. 
On May 13th, 2020, the first album in two years "BURST POP ISLAND" was released via Nippon Columbia, and they released a new digital single “GOD SAVE THE MUSIC” on August 27th, 2021.
Their distinctive music filled with unpredictable structures, billions of fantastic and catchy melodies, and friendly male and female twin vocals stimulates listeners' emotions no matter how old they are.

[Website](https://tempest-official.jp/) | [Twitter (KR)](https://twitter.com/TPST__official) | [Twitter (JP)](https://twitter.com/TPST__JP) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tpst__official/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCViKQ1A1tXhIVKAVEazcaA)

TEMPEST is a South Korean boy band under Yuehua Entertainment. The group is composed of seven members: Hanbin, Hyeongseop, Hyuk, Eunchan, Lew, Hwarang, and Taerae. They made their debut on March 2, 2022, with their debut extended play, It's Me, It's We.

[Website](https://icex.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ICEx_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/icex_official_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@ICEx_official)

ICEx (アイス) is an eight-member dance and vocal boy group formed under STARDUST PROMOTION on March 31, 2023.

The group made their major debut on August 16, 2023 with their first single, CANDY, under Victor Entertainment.
